name: Mung Bean Omelet (Vegan Omelet No Chickpea Flour } Dal Chilla
description: Lentil Mung Bean Omelet (Vegan Omelette No Chickpea Flour) Dal Chilla Stuffed with Blackened Tempeh, Okra, Broccoli and served with a creamy vegan havarti dressing. Vegan Breakfast or Brunch Soyfree Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup yellow mung beans (, split mung bean (moong dal))
1 tsp salt (less or more to taste)
4 oz cubed Tempeh,  ((Steam to reduce the bitter tempeh taste for 10 mins))
1/2 cup sliced sweet peppers or red bell pepper
1-2 tsps blackening spice or creole spice blend
Havarti Cream Sauce (See notes) or Or use Daiya Garlic Jalapeno havarti Wedge (, or vegan ranch or mayo)

itemListElement.text: Wash and soak the lentils and mung beans in hot water 1 hour or overnight. Drain, add to blender with all the ingredients and blend. Blend 2-3 cycles for a smooth batter. (Pink lentils and yellow mung beans are easily available in an Indian store or large stores like Whole foods.) If making ahead, add baking powder to the batter just before cooking the pancakes.
itemListElement.name: Wash and soak the lentils and mung beans in hot water 1 hour or overnight. Drain, add to blender with all the ingredients and blend. Blend 2-3 cycles for a smooth batter. (Pink lentils and yellow mung beans are easily available in an Indian store or large stores like Whole foods.) If making ahead, add baking powder to the batter just before cooking the pancakes.

itemListElement.text: Heat a pan on medium heat. Grease it if needed. Drop a ladle of the batter Spread with the ladle or by tapping the pan. Drizzle a few drops of oil on the edges. Let cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden at the bottom. Flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve as is (they are delicious as is too), or with the blackened veggies and dressing..
itemListElement.name: Heat a pan on medium heat. Grease it if needed. Drop a ladle of the batter Spread with the ladle or by tapping the pan. Drizzle a few drops of oil on the edges. Let cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden at the bottom. Flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve as is (they are delicious as is too), or with the blackened veggies and dressing..

itemListElement.text: In a pan, heat oil on medium high. Add the chopped Okra and Tempeh and cook for 6-7 minutes (stir occasionally). Add broccoli and peppers, reduce heat to medium and continue cooking until okra is crisp and Tempeh is evenly brown(10+ minutes). Stir occasionally. Add the blackening spice, garlic and salt and cook for another 1-3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In a pan, heat oil on medium high. Add the chopped Okra and Tempeh and cook for 6-7 minutes (stir occasionally). Add broccoli and peppers, reduce heat to medium and continue cooking until okra is crisp and Tempeh is evenly brown(10+ minutes). Stir occasionally. Add the blackening spice, garlic and salt and cook for another 1-3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Serve the pancakes hot, stuffed with the veggies and drizzled with vegan havarti cream or other cheesy dressing of choice.
itemListElement.name: Serve the pancakes hot, stuffed with the veggies and drizzled with vegan havarti cream or other cheesy dressing of choice.

keywords: mung bean eggs, vegan omelet no chickpea flour
